intro: Chytranthus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered chytranthus, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
